content:
I think I'll go with the mid-range option, The Kayana Seminyak. It seems to offer a good balance of comfort, location, and price. I'll book it through Booking.com.

Now that I have my accommodations and itinerary sorted, I'm feeling more confident about my trip to Bali. Thanks for your help and recommendations!

Oh, and one more thing - I just marked one year of being in my current job, so I'm looking forward to celebrating this milestone in Bali. It's going to be a well-deserved break!
